purpose.to_describe: the metadata and form of a NetCDF-format file

abbrev_widget_len.description: an arbitrary example of a data variable

xxxxx_Group_Attributes.group: can omit/empty, xxxxx is group name

summary.value: The PREFIRE 1B-RAD product provides calibrated, geolocated TIRS spectro-radiometer data, along with associated time and geometric parameters.

obs_ID.description: unique integer identifier for each TIRS observation
obs_ID.value_meaning: YYYYMMDDhhmmsstbd; UTC date and time at TIRS image integration midpoint, t=tenths of seconds, b=[1-2]=satellite number, d=[1-8]=scene number

ctime.description: at the midpoint of each TIRS image integration; similar to TAI, and referenced to the epoch 2000-01-01T00:00:00 UTC

ctime_minus_UTC.description: leap seconds since the ctime epoch, at the midpoint of each TIRS image integration

time_UTC_values.description: UTC datetime at the midpoint of each TIRS image integration, represented as an integer array
time_UTC_values.ArrayPart_meaning: year, month, day, hour, minute, second, millisecond

latitude.description: topography-corrected latitude of the FOV center (i.e., at the TIRS image integration midpoint)

longitude.description: topography-corrected longitude of the FOV center (i.e., at the TIRS image integration midpoint)

vertex_latitude.description: topography-corrected latitude for each of the four vertices/corners (arranged counter-clockwise starting at the trailing-left corner) of a 4-sided polygon that closely approximates the geolocated FOV (orbital motion taken into account)

vertex_longitude.description: topography-corrected longitude for each of the four vertices/corners (arranged counter-clockwise starting at the trailing-left corner) of a 4-sided polygon that closely approximates the geolocated FOV (orbital motion taken into account)

land_fraction.description: land_area / total_area (remainder is water_area) within the FOV, according to the Digital Elevation Model (DEM)

elevation.description: mean topographic elevation within the FOV

elevation_stdev.description: standard deviation of topographic elevation within the FOV

viewing_zenith_angle.description: viewing zenith angle at the FOV center (i.e., at the TIRS image integration midpoint)

viewing_azimuth_angle.description: viewing azimuth angle at the FOV center (i.e., at the TIRS image integration midpoint; zero is north, clockwise-positive looking down from the zenith)

solar_zenith_angle.description: solar zenith angle at the FOV center (i.e., at the TIRS image integration midpoint)

solar_azimuth_angle.description: solar azimuth angle at the FOV center (i.e., at the TIRS image integration midpoint; zero is north, clockwise-positive looking down from the zenith)

solar_distance.description: distance from FOV center (i.e., at the TIRS image integration midpoint) to the solar barycenter

sat_altitude.description: satellite altitude above the reference ellipsoid (at the sub-satellite point)

sat_solar_illumination_flag.description: flag specifying whether (and to what general extent) one hemisphere of the spacecraft is illuminated by the sun

geoloc_quality_bitflags.description: integer composed of bit flags that contain boolean info about the quality of the overall geolocation of each scene
geoloc_quality_bitflags.value_meaning: [b0] topo-correction unfinished due to too many iterations?

maxintgz_verts_lat.long_name: latitude, vertices of zone with maximum TIRS image integration time
maxintgz_verts_lat.description: latitude (topographically-corrected) for each of the four vertices/corners (arranged counter-clockwise starting at the trailing-left corner) of a 4-sided polygon that closely approximates the geolocated zone with the maximum TIRS image integration time

maxintgz_verts_lon.long_name: longitude, vertices of zone with maximum TIRS image integration time
maxintgz_verts_lon.description: longitude (topographically-corrected) for each of the four vertices/corners (arranged counter-clockwise starting at the trailing-left corner) of a 4-sided polygon that closely approximates the geolocated zone with the maximum TIRS image integration time

orbit_phase_metric.description: orbit phase angular metric (range of 0-360 degrees, varying approximately linearly with time), defined as 0 deg at the ascending node (northward equator crossing) of the satellite orbit, 180 deg at the descending node, and so on

satellite_pass_type.description: flag specifying which type of satellite pass each frame is mostly/all part of

detector_ID.description: unique integer identifier for each TIRS detector

detector_bitflags.description: integer composed of bit flags that contain boolean info about each TIRS channel/scene combination
detector_bitflags.value_meaning: [b0] detector masked, [b1] extreme noise or unresponsive detector, [b2] greater-noise category, [b3] unreliable calibration due to stray light contribution, [b4] unreliable calibration due to thermal effects, [b5] unreliable calibration due to filter-edge effects

wavelength.description: center wavelength of each spectral channel, given by the SRF-weighted mean over wavelength

idealized_wavelength.description: center wavelength of each spectral channel, in the idealized spectrometer grid

spectral_radiance_unc.description: uncertainty of the calibrated spectral radiance values (channels 1-63)

observation_bitflags.description: integer composed of bit flags that contain boolean info about special circumstances of the overall radiance observation at each frame
observation_bitflags.value_meaning: [b0] thermal transient after payload-on-but-safed period (e.g., during/near downlink contacts and GPS zenith pointing), [b1] small thermal/radiometric perturbation present (e.g., near eclipse exit), [b2] large thermal/radiometric perturbation present (e.g., near eclipse entrance), [b3] greater-than-normal temperature change within this orbit (during the thermal transient after powering instrument back on), [b4] moderate time interval between observation and the nearest calibration sequence (due to corrupted or missing calibration sequence(s)), [b5] large time interval between observation and the nearest calibration sequence (due to corrupted or missing calibration sequence(s)), [b6] bus telemetry indicates that spacecraft attitude determination is invalid, [b7] lack of spacecraft attitude information due to a bus telemetry gap, [b8] during an unknown type of bus slew, [b9] during a modeled-sun-avoidance type of bus slew, [b10] electronics warm-up period after powering instrument on

calibration_bitflags.description: integer composed of bit flags that contain boolean info about special circumstances of the calibration calculation at each frame, spectral channel, and scene
calibration_bitflags.value_meaning: [b0] invalid calibration, [b1] calibration not attempted (e.g., masked detector)

radiance_quality_flag.description: overall spectral radiance quality flag, representing the combination of detector, observation, and calibration quality flags

detector_quality_flag.description: quality flag describing characteristics of detectors (i.e., spectral channels) for each scene

calibration_quality_flag.description: flag describing the calibration calculation quality at each frame, spectral channel, and scene

spectral_BT.description: the calibrated, spectrally-resolved TIRS brightness temperature (channels 1-63)

spectral_BT_unc.description: uncertainty of the calibrated spectral brightness temperature values (channels 1-63)

BT_quality_flag.description: overall brightness temperature quality flag, representing the combination of relevant detector, observation, and radiance quality flags

channel_0_radiance.description: total spectrally integrated radiance from direct-illuminated TIRS channel 0

channel_0_radiance_unc.description: uncertainty of the total spectrally integrated radiance from direct-illuminated TIRS channel 0

channel_0_detector_bitflags.description: integer composed of bit flags that contain boolean info about TIRS channel 0 for each scene
channel_0_detector_bitflags.value_meaning: [b0] detector masked, [b1] extreme noise or unresponsive detector, [b2] greater-noise category, [b3] unreliable calibration due to stray light contribution, [b4] unreliable calibration due to thermal effects, [b5] unreliable calibration due to filter-edge effects

channel_0_detector_quality_flag.description: quality flag describing characteristics of channel 0 detectors

channel_0_radiance_quality_flag.description: overall spectral radiance quality flag, representing the combination of any detector, observation, and radiance quality flags for channel 0
